newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish opposition hit by more resignations.
newsitem.headline: Turkish opposition hit by more resignations.

text.p: Turkey's opposition suffered more losses on Wednesday when the former Islamist-led government's economy minister joined the new secularist coalition and two MPs resigned from their parties.

Anatolian news agency said Ufuk Soylemez, the previous state minister responsible for the economy, joined the small Democratic Turkey Party, junior partners in Prime Minister Mesut Yilmaz's left-right coalition.
One MP resigned from ex-prime minister Necmettin Erbakan's Islam-based Welfare Party and another deputy quit the True Path Party, headed by previous foreign minister Tansu Ciller.
A year-long coalition between the Islamists and conservative Ciller collapsed last month under pressure from the secularist army.
Defections and resignations by True Path deputies dissatisfied with the alliance have taken the party to 93 seats from the 135 it won at the last election in December, 1995.
Democratic Turkey Party leader Husamettin Cindoruk was quoted in newspapers on Wednesday as saying he expected more MPs to join his group, originally a splinter from True Path.
Cindoruk's party, now with 18 deputies, needs just two more members to qualify for places on important government commissions which are still controlled by members of the previous coalition.
